I, Samuel S. Curtis, duly appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, a commissioner of the State of Kentucky, resident at the city of Boston, in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, do solemly swear that I will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such commissioner, under and by virture of the laws of said State of Kentucky

Subscribed and sworn to this twenty ninth day of July, A. D. 1864.
Before Me

W. W. Fowles
Justice of the Peace
July 29 1864
